intro: Stenocarpus laurifolius, commonly known as the golden wattle, is a flowering plant native to eastern Australia. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod-like fruits. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and have a leathery texture with a bright green color. The flowers are yellow and appear in clusters, making it a striking ornamental plant.
